Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050222-0821
Webtools: 1.0M3

While running under a debugger with 'suspend on uncaught exceptions' turned on:
1. Create a new file called 'build.xml'
2. Observe that a ClassCastException has been thrown (it is not logged anywhere)

java.lang.ClassCastException
    at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.editor.AntEditor.updateForInitialReconcile(AntEditor.java:879)
    at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.editor.AntEditor.reconciled(AntEditor.java:964)
    at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.editor.text.NotifyingReconciler.notifyReconcilingParticipants(NotifyingReconciler.java:54)
    at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.editor.text.NotifyingReconciler.initialProcess(NotifyingReconciler.java:62)
    at
org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.AbstractReconciler$BackgroundThread.run(AbstractReconciler.java:170)

The document returned is a JobSafeStructuredDocument not an ISynchronizable.

The Ant editor should probably be checking the docuemnt type before casting, but
i don't see why the file should have had a structured source editor content type
since there was no content and the filename was build.xml.

I think this general situation will be much improved with M6 and WTP M4 (with
improvements in ant content type detection and editor association by content
type ... but, moving this but to 'ant editor' in case you want to clean up any
remaining assumptions about the return type of 

provider.getDocument
Corrected in the AntEditor to attempt to handle these situations better.
